contents.recipe: Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Blend
Mix the eggs with salt and pepper in a bowl. In a pan, sauté the spinach and the tomatoes until soft, then pour the eggs. Leave to cook for 2-3 minutes and flip.
Cut the bacon in thin rashes and cook until crispy. Add the vegetables and sauté until soft. Add salt and pepper, then the eggs. Mix until the eggs cook.
Mix the eggs with salt and pepper in a bowl. Sauté the peppers in a pan until they soften then pour the eggs. Leave to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add avocado cubes and serve hot.
Heat up the pan and add the onion and pepper. Sauté until soft then add salt, pepper, and eggs. Mix the ingredients until the eggs cook. Serve with salsa.
Mix and serve.
Clean the fruit and blend with the cheese, honey, and condiments. Serve with cantaloupe slices and mint leaves.
Cut the fruit and mix with yogurt. Serve with coconut flakes on top.
Heat up some oil n the pan and mix the apple, nuts, and cinnamon until the apple cooks. Mix 3 eggs and put them in the pan. Leave until the egg cooks.
Blend and store in the fridge.

Cut the chicken breast into cubes. Clean the mushrooms in thin slices.
In a pan, heat the olive oil, then add the chicken for 2-3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and leave on low heat. Leave for 5 minutes.
Boil the cauliflower, then leave it in salted water for 5 minutes. Pour over the chicken in the pan. After mushrooms cooked, put some salt, pepper, and chili after taste. Serve with parmesan and parsley.

Preheat the oven at 200°C. Condiment the chicken with salt and pepper then put it on a baking tray. Bake for 35-40 minutes.
In the meantime, mix the diced vegetables in a bowl. Leave in the fridge until the chicken is cooked then pour the mix over it.

Preheat the oven at 200°C, mix the diced vegetables with the melted coconut oil in a bowl. Add salt, pepper, and other condiments after taste.
Condiment the chicken with salt and pepper, then place on baking paper. Place the vegetables next to the meat and bake for 35-40 minutes. Until everything is cooked.

Heat the coconut oil in a pan, then add the diced chicken. Cook until the meat is well done and put on a plate. In the same pan with the leftover oil, add the broccoli, bell pepper, carrots and the diced garlic, cook until soft. When the vegetables have the desired consistency (a bit crispy preferred), add the chicken and condiments, then cook for another 2-3 minutes.

Simmer all the ingredients on low heat until you get a stew with sauce.
Serve with polenta or rice if lunchtime, by itself if dinner.

Fry the minced meat in a pan. Add the taco mix and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Serve with cabbage/kale, avocado, and salsa.

Combine all the condiments in one bowl. Marinate the chicken with this mix and leave for 10 minutes to absorb.
Heat the coconut oil in a pan and add the marinated chicken. Cook 6 minutes on each side or until it turns golden. Add the garlic and lime juice and cook for another 5 minutes, flipping to cover the chicken in sauce.
On a tray, place a piece of baking paper and put the squash on it to form a bed. Add the chicken, tomatoes, and olives. Roll the paper such that it encapsulates all the food and bake for 20 minutes.

contents.recipeName: Chicken Breast Skewers with Cucumber Salad
contents.recipe:
Dice the chicken and vegetables. Stick them on skewers so that they alternate, then grill for 3-4 minutes on each side.
Cut the cucumber in stick and add the green onion, salt, pepper, lemon juice and the dill.

contents.recipeName: Grilled Chicken Livers with Broccoli Salad
contents.recipe:
Serve with 100g of quinoa or rice (if served for lunch, otherwise serve as it is).
Wash the livers and grill for 3 minutes on each side, then season with salt and leave aside for a few minutes.
Split the broccoli in florets and boil for 5 minutes in salted water.
Make the dressing out of yogurt, green onion, and finely diced garlic.
Mix the broccoli diced tomatoes, then add the dressing and raisins.

Season the meat with salt, pepper, and chili powder, then cover in flour.
Fry in the heated olive until a crust forms (about 4 minutes per side). Add the aromatic herbs, lemon juice, and some lemon slices.
Serve with lettuce.

Heat the coconut oil in a pan and add the marinated chicken for 6 minutes per side. Add the garlic and lime juice and cook for another 5 minutes, flipping constantly to absorb the juices.
Heat the wrap on the pan for a few seconds until soft, then place the chicken and grilled veggies inside and roll.

Mix the quail eggs, milk, flour, and dry condiments for the pancake batter.
In a pan, cook the diced bell pepper and chicken with 1Tbsp of water under the lid until cooked, then add the condiments.
Make the crepes, add the chicken and pepper mix, roll and enjoy!
Mix the condiments, then add to the minced meat and mix. Grill and serve with salad.

Shred the squash finely or grate, whatever you find easier for giving a spaghetti shape.
Heat the oil in an anti-adherent pan and cook the spaghetti, salt, and pepper in it at moderate heat. Flip a couple times on each side to avoid burning.
Separately, cook the spinach a little in coconut oil until if becomes soft and let chill.
Preheat the oven at 200°C and place a piece of baking paper on a tray.
Mix the flour with the mince, eggs, and condiments in a bowl. Make the meatballs in the size you desire.
Bake for 25-30 minutes.

Dice the red bell pepper, onion, tomato, and celery, crush the garlic with a knife blade.
Heat half the quantity of butter in a tall pan. Add the mince and season after taste with salt and black pepper. While cooking the meat until done, split the mince finely. Place in a bowl after cooking and cover to keep hot.
Add the rest of the butter and the diced vegetables, without the tomatoes. Cook for 3-4 minutes until soft, then add the hot condiments (chili and pepper), continuously stirring for a minute.
Increase the heat to moderate, add the tomatoes, chicken soup, and bay leaves. Boil at high heat. Reduce again to moderate and cook for about 15 minutes without a lid. Add the mince and cook for another 5 minutes to mix. Remove bay leaf and serve.

Preheat the oven at 190°C.
Grate the potato and carrot, then mix in a bowl with all the other ingredients.
Make some balls the size of a golf ball and bake for about 40 minutes (in a glass tray preferably).

Shred the turkey breast and cook. Add the bell pepper and onion shreds and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and lemon juice for another 2 minutes.
Serve with fresh parsley.

contents.recipeName: Turkey breast with Capers Sauce & Spinach salad
contents.recipe:
Grill the turkey breast.
Melt the butter at low heat in a pan and add the capers, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook for a little bit and pour over the chicken.
Wash the fresh spinach and serve as a salad with lemon juice, salt, pepper and balsamic vinegar.

Dice the pork in cubes about 1cm thick.
Add 1 Tbsp of water to the wok and stew the garlic and grated ginger, then add the pork and roast for about 5 minutes. Add the shredded veggies and leave for another 5 minutes until they soften. Sprinkle some soy sauce and serve with freshly diced parsley.

Start boiling the rice before cooking the food as it will take about 10 minutes to prepare everything else.
Heat the oil in the wok and add the diced garlic and chili.
Add the veggies and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add the diced green onion and soy sauce and leave for another minute, then add the salmon.
Stir and serve with rice.

Preheat the oven at 160°C. Place the papers in the muffin tray.
Dice and place the dried tuna and feta in a bowl and mix.
Dice the vegetables finely, add in a bowl and stir.
Mix the eggs, yogurt, salt, pepper and leaves, then mix it all together.
Place in muffin papers and bake for about 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

Make pesto out of the diced leaves in a mortar and add the minced garlic, olive oil, and lime juice. Crush until mixed.
Put the pesto on the cleaned bream. Leave for 20-30 minutes in the fridge. Grill for 3-4 minutes on each side and serve with rucola.

Clean the fresh asparagus, remove the harder bit, and boil with the carrots and green beans for about 5 minutes.
In a wok, heat the oil and add the crushed garlic, chili, and soy sauce, and cook the vegetables for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve this mix with the smoked salmon and sprinkle some fine green onion bits.

Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Wash and shred the fennel, mix with sour cream, salt and pepper, then place in a glass tray as a bed. Place the salmon on top and cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with green leaves.

Boil the pasta 2 minutes less than it says on the packet (later the pasta will be added in the sauce and cook there for a bit as well).
Dice the onion, garlic and basil finely, the tomatoes in small cubes, and remove the seeds from the chili.
Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onion until glassy, then add the sugar and salt. Add the garlic and chili and leave for another 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and wine and leave for another 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes, lemon juice, salt and pepper and boil with the pasta and some water from the boiling pot.
Add sauce and stir for another 2 minutes.

Boil the pasta.
In the meantime, dice the garlic and onion finely, then cook both until the onion becomes translucid. Cut the cherry tomatoes in halves and add the aromatized oi. Add shredded basil. Add condiments after taste. Serve with raw olive oil.

Preheat the olive oil in a pot. Cook the onion, carrot, celery, and mushrooms for 15 minutes. Add the mince and condiments and cook until the meat is almost ready. Add the tomato juice and let to simmer for 2 hours.
Serve with salad.

Cook the garlic for a minute in a pan with frying oil. Add the mix of beef and condiments.
Cook the onion and bell pepper in a deeper pot until they soften and place the contents of the pan inside.
Stir and leave for 30 minutes.
Stir every now and again.

Dice the vegetables.
Mix the condiments and 1/2 of the onion with the mince in a bowl. Make the meatballs and place in the pan at medium heat for about 10 minutes on all sides. When done, add the diced vegetables and cook until soft.

Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Mix the condiments and 1/2 of the onion with the mince in a bowl. Make the meatballs and place in the pan at medium heat for about 10 minutes on all sides.
Place a sheet of baking paper on a tray and add the meatballs and vegetables.
Bake until golden.

Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Mix the condiments and 1/2 of the onion with the mince in a bowl. Make the meatballs and bake for 45 minutes or until cooked.

Open the broccoli in florets and boil for 3-4 minutes, then place in cold water.
Beat the eggs with salt and pepper, add cheese and mix. Bake for 10 minutes with the broccoli.
Cut the beef in 1.5-2cm slices and grill for about 3 minutes on each side until it forms a crust. Add salt and pepper after cooking and serve with the baked mix.

Wash and boil the potatoes without peeling. Dice the onion and crush the garlic.
Cook the onion in a heated pan with oil until it turns glassy, then add garlic, salt, pepper, all the leaves, and the white sauce (?). Boil at high heat.
In another pan cook the meat with condiments, and in the meantime but the potatoes in slices about 0.5 cm thick. When the meat is cooked, mix with the other ingredients except potatoes.
Place baking paper on a deep oven tray. Add 1/3 of the potatoes on the bottom, then half the meat sauce, another 1/3 of the potatoes, the other half of the sauce, and the last 1/3 of potatoes as a lid on top. Pour a generous amount of white sauce on top and spread evenly. Bake for 20, then add the cheese on top, and leave for another 10 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Serve with pickles, cabbage salad, or beetroot salad.

Remove the fat from the steak and slice finely. Cut the chili and shred the ginger.
Heat a pan with oil and cook the steak 2 minutes on each side. Add the chili and ginger and cook for another 2 minutes.
Place on a plate and keep warm.
Cook the cucumber and radishes in the remaining oil for a minute and serve with the meat.

Preheat the oven.
Cut the steak finely and place on a tray with baking paper. Add salt, pepper, coriander, mustard, and a cup of water. Bake for 30 minutes.
Grate the kale and season with salt & pepper, then sprinkle some lemon juice or vinegar. You can also add parsley or finely chopped dill.

Cut the steak in 1cm slices and wrap in a slice of prosciutto and 2 salvia leaves. Grill for 2-3 minutes each side.
Serve with salad greens and lemon juice.

Preheat the oven at 200°C. Place baking paper on a tray and split the squash into 2 on the long side. Take out the seeds and bake for 20-25 minutes or until it softens (avoid burning). Let cool, take out the middle, and grate into spaghetti.
In the meantime, cook onion in a pan at medium heat for a few minutes, then add the meat and condiments. Cook until the meat turns brown and add the tomato juice. Let the sauce simmer.
Mix the squash and meat, then add the beaten eggs.
Bake in a glass tray until it turns golden.

Crush the garlic and cook in a pan with oil for a few minutes. Add the peas until it gets a little crispy. Season with salt and dill & parsley leaves, then add a little water and boil for 2-3 minutes.
Cook the garlic in a pan with oil. Raise the heat and add the washed spinach. Cook until the spinach is soft, then season with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven at 200°C.
Cut the eggplant in 0.5 cm slices, then salt and add olive oil. Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella. Form the towers by putting eggplant at the base, then tomato and mozzarella. Bake for 15 minutes and serve with parmesan, condiments, and lemon juice.

Clean the cantaloupe, dice it and blend with honey, lemon juice and water. Freeze for 30 minutes in a plastic cup. Take out, crush, and leave for another 20 minutes.
Serve with ice and mint leaves.

Boil the rice in salted water.
Dice the kale and leek.
Finely dice the onion and garlic, then cook in coconut oil. Add curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add coconut milk. Add then the kale and lentils, and boil with a lid for 15 minutes.
Fry the sesame seeds without oil in a different pan and add in the mix. Boil for another 2 minutes.
Add salt and pepper.

Put the couscous in a bowl and pour 100ml of boiling water on top. Leave for 10 minutes. At the end, add oil and lemon juice.
Grill the halloumi sticks.
Dice the bell pepper and cucumber, slice the onion in rings. Finely chop the parsley and mint leaves. Add to the couscous and serve with halloumi.

Cut the eggplant on the long edge and take out the middle just enough to add the filling.
Dice the garlic, onion, bell pepper, and carrots, then cook with the middle of the eggplant and beans/chickpeas. Add the tomato juice, bay leaf & pepper, and cook for 15-20 minutes.
Preheat the oven.
Fill the eggplant with this mix and bake for 20-30 minutes.
Serve with yogurt and finely cut parsley.

Cut the squash on the long edge and take out the middle just enough to add the filling.
Dice the tomatoes and parsley.
Dice and cook the mushrooms for 3 minutes. Add the parsley & tomatoes and leave for another 2 minutes. Fill the squash with the mix combined with diced chicken ham and bake at 200°C. 5 minutes before taking out, sprinkle feta on top. Serve with Ayran and fresh mint.
Shred the zucchini and cook for a few minutes with oil, salt, and pepper.

Bake the eggplant and mix it with onion, olive oil, salt, pepper, and lemon juice. This is the eggplant salad.
Add the walnuts and beans, then spread on/inside the roll and add tofu.
Serve with a side of tomato salad.

Slice the tomatoes, bell pepper, and mushrooms. Dice the spinach.
Season the mix of these ingredients with salt and pepper, then cook in olive oil for 10 minutes. Add lemon juice and basil, leave it cool for 2-3 minutes. While the veggies cool, heat the wrap, then place the mix inside.
Add the shredded lettuce and radicchio leaves in a bowl. Cut the cauliflower in quarters and then shred and cut the onion in rings.

Finely dice the onion and garlic, then cook in a pan with 1 Tbsp of water under the lid.
Dice all the other veggies into cubes and cook the same way for 15 minutes. Add more water if necessary.
Season with salt, pepper, and condiments. Serve with chicken/ turkey breast.
Mix the condiments.

Finely dice the mushrooms, spinach, and garlic. Dice the carrots and tomatoes into cubes.
Cook the garlic in a pan with olive oil and a bay leaf for about a minute. Add all the other veggies and cook for 10 minutes. At the end, add the basil leaves.
Mix nutmeg with flour, salt, pepper, and milk nutmeg, then cook at low heat until it reaches a thick consistency.
Preheat the oven at 200°C.
In a deep tray, pour some olive oil and start mounting with the lasagna sheets, then veggies and bechamel sauce. Bake until the top layer becomes golden.

Preheat the oven at 180°C.
Dice the vegetables in medium cubes. Place a sheet of baking paper on a tray and add pour the vegetables over. Sprinkle some olive oil, lemon juice, and condiments. Bake for 25-30 minutes.
Serve simple or with yogurt & mint leaf sauce (yogurt, mint leaves, lemon juice, salt, pepper)
Cut and mix with salad dressing.
Cut and mix with salad dressing.
Cut and serve as side.

contents.recipeName: Mango Feta Salad with Yogurt Dressing
contents.recipe:
Cook the pine seeds in a pan without oil for a few minutes.
Mix the yogurt and lemon peel & juice, salt, pepper and pine seeds.
Cut the feta and mango into cubes, then mix with the salad greens and pour the dressing.

Peel and slice the beetroot. Separate and wash the lettuce. Slice the avocado and half the quantity of orange. The other half is squeezed with vinegar, oil, salt and pepper as a dressing.
On top of the lettuce, add the beetroot slices, orange, avocado, and hard-boiled eggs.

Boil the green beans for 3 minutes straight into hot water, then cool with cold water.
Make a dressing out of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic and herbs.
Dice everything else and mix with the rest.

Clean the avocado and sprinkle some lemon juice on top. Mash with a fork, then add the cottage chees, salt, pepper, and other condiments. Stir well. Add the tuna without brine and mix.
Place the lettuce leaves on a plate, add the tuna paste, and top with tomatoes.
Cut the cucumber and carrot and mix with the rest.

Cook the couscous.
Grill and slice the turkey.
Slice the squash and dice the tomatoes and peaches. Mix the couscous and serve with the turkey breast, salt, pepper, mint, and lemon juice.

Slice and boil the turkey breast for 10 minutes.
Dice the cauliflower and carrot, mix with peas.
Dice the meat when it’s ready and serve with the vegetables. Out of everything else make a dressing for the meat.

Cut the washed vegetables into rings, dice the mozzarella and mix with everything else.
Serve with a slice of toast.

Slice the chicken breast, season with salt and add some rosemary leaves. 
Cove with baking paper and beat to combine tastes. Cook in a pan for 4 minutes each side, then grill. 
Toast a slice of bread and dice it.
Make the dressing and serve with leaves and vegetables (recipe 69).
Add the chicken on top and serve with croutons.

Grill the turkey, then slice finely.
Make the dressing out of yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and parsley.
Mix everything in a bowl.
Mix well and refrigerate in a well-sealed glass container.

Open the cauliflower in florets, but the fennel in sticks. Boil with the onion for 15 minutes. Add the hot milk, herbs, salt, and pepper. Mash until you get a creamy texture. Serve with cooked prosciutto slices (meat crisps).

Use the cube to make a quick soup.
Clean the onion and garlic. Peel and dice the sweet potatoes.
Cook until the onion becomes glassy, then add the sweet potatoes and chicken soup. Boil for about 30 minutes.
After cooking, add the chickpeas and blend.
Season with salt, pepper, and chili.

Finely dice the onion and garlic.
Slice the mushrooms and stew them all in a pan. Add water to cover and cook for 10 minutes.
After cooking, blend until they become creamy, then season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Serve with parsley and crushed pistachios.

Clean the onion and peel the ginger. Peel and dice the carrots and celery.
Cook the onion in a pan with heated oil until it becomes glassy. Add the shredded ginger, bay leaf, carrots and celery and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add water, salt and pepper to cover, then boil for 15 minutes.
Cook the sunflower seeds in a dry pan.
Dice the cheese and take the leaves off the thyme twig.
When the soup is ready, take out the bay leaf and blend everything. Add water from the boiling process to get the desired thickness.
Sprinkle the seeds, feta, and thyme leaves as topping.

Cut the cleaned leek into thin rings and cook in butter for 5 minutes. Add sugar and let caramelize, then add the wine. Boil for 4-5 minutes and add the vegetable soup, salt, and yogurt. Cook for another 15 minutes with the lid on, stirring occasionally.
Serve with camembert or brie.

Preheat the oven at 200°C.
Place muffin papers in the muffin tray holes for 8 pieces.
In a bowl, mash the banana with a fork. Add the oil and eggs, then blend until mixed. Add flour little by little, then the salt and baking powder. Add lemon juice and crushed walnuts. If you don’t trust the sweetness to be enough, add cinnamon.
Bake for about 20 minutes or until done.

Dice the tomato and onion.
Cut the avocado in half and take out the middle, then squish with a fork.
Mix everything together.

Preheat the oven at 200°C.
Prepare the muffin tray with papers. Don’t just use oil, egg sticks easily to trays.
Cook the turkey meat and add the condiments.
Mix in a bowl with tomatoes, peppers, onion and eggs.
Pun in muffin papers and bake for 20-30 minutes or until baked.

Leave the mint and some bits of fruit out and blend the ingredients. Put in a plastic container and freeze for a few hours.
Hourly, mix so that it doesn’t get ice flakes.
Serve when you reach the desired consistency.
Serve together.
Cut the carrot into sticks and serve with ham as a snack.

Mix the cheeses, salt, pepper, and dill until you get a paste.
Serve with veggie sticks.
Blend and serve with ice.

Finely cut the almonds with a knife.
Pour 100 ml of water in a pot and boil. Add the almonds and boil for 2 minutes. Stop the heat and add the lemon juice, almond extract, and honey. Mix well and let the syrup cool.
Cut the peaches in half and take out the seeds. Take out some of the pulp to make peach baskets out of the halves.
Let the halves cool and mix the removed pulp with the syrup until it becomes a paste. Freeze for a little bit, then use this “ice cream” to fill out the baskets in the fridge.

Grill the turkey breast.
Dice the grilled turkey breast and mozzarella.
Wash and dice the vegetables.
Add salt and pepper.
Make a sauce out of the yogurt, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Pour on the diced ingredients and season with finely diced basil.
